ETYMOLOGY: Shortened form of poliomyelitis, which comes from Greek poliós (πολιός, 'gray') + myelós (μυελός, 'marrow', referring to the gray matter of the spinal cord) + -itis (inflammation).
SINCE: Late 19th century (as poliomyelitis); early 20th century (as polio)

MEANINGS.DEF_EN: An infectious viral disease that affects the central nervous system, sometimes causing paralysis and even death, primarily affecting children.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 一种由病毒引起的传染病，主要影响中枢神经系统，有时导致瘫痪甚至死亡，主要影响儿童。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: The global effort to eradicate polio through vaccination has been largely successful.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 通过疫苗接种在全球范围内根除脊髓灰质炎的努力已基本成功。
